title: Data, Economics, and Design of Policy: International Development

courses.title: Microeconomics

page.description: Use economic models to learn how prices and markets benefit society in the face of scarcity.

courses.description: Use economic models to learn how prices and markets benefit society in the face of scarcity.

courses.title: Designing and Running Randomized Evaluations

page.description: This course equips students with the practical skills for running evaluations in the field. Students will learn the foundations of randomizations and research design, as well as practical tips and skills for collecting high quality, reliable data in the field.

courses.description: This course equips students with the practical skills for running evaluations in the field. Students will learn the foundations of randomizations and research design, as well as practical tips and skills for collecting high quality, reliable data in the field.

courses.title: Data Analysis for Social Scientists

page.description: Learn methods for harnessing and analyzing data to answer questions of cultural, social, economic, and policy interest.

courses.description: Learn methods for harnessing and analyzing data to answer questions of cultural, social, economic, and policy interest.

courses.title: Foundations of Development Policy

page.description: Examine the different facets of human development, including education, health, gender, the family, land relations, risk, public policy, and institutions. At the same time, discover modern empirical methods in economics while working with real data.

courses.title: Political Economy and Economic Development

page.description: Explore why and how political institutions affect economic development, and apply key theories and empirical techniques to real-world examples ranging from voting and corruption to the role of the media.

courses.description: Explore why and how political institutions affect economic development, and apply key theories and empirical techniques to real-world examples ranging from voting and corruption to the role of the media.

courses.title: The Challenges of Global Poverty

page.description: A course for those who are interested in the challenge posed by massive and persistent world poverty.

courses.description: A course for those who are interested in the challenge posed by massive and persistent world poverty.

page.description: Grapple with some of the world’s most pressing problems from a rigorous, data-driven perspective developed by Nobel prize winners Esther Duflo and Abhijit Banerjee. Complete three core courses and two out of three electives plus proctored exams to earn your credential. You may then apply to the Master’s degree offered by MIT’s #1 world-ranked Economics Department.
